TopicTitle: Engines are on and part of ship explodes when I load a custom quick save

Articles.Content:
I made an Alt + F5 quick save before using time warp. I entered the time warp on a different vessel so I could warp faster. When I came back to my vessel of interest the engines were on and when the loading finished the engines were suddenly off. At that moment part of the payload exploded (the wings on some attached gliders) and an explosion happened in space where there wasn't even any vessel or (known/expected) object to explode.

When I go back to the pre-time warp quick save, the exact same thing happens. Engines are on and then switched off and stuff explodes. I [uploaded the quick save to my dropbox account](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/1918347/Eve%20glider%20transfer%20pre-warp.sfs) in case that helps.

This game's quirks are so confusing! After attempting to solve the problem by editing saves and failing, I went back to the original save (the one I posted above) and while the engines were on while they should not have been, no part of the ship exploded! There's obviously more to ships exploding out of time warp than what is contained within the save. My computer was also switched off since yesterday so that's uncontrolled-for.

Sometimes, when you run into engines (even if unrelated to the engines), it can cause something like this to happen. Especially with exploding ships, restarting KSP is often helpful.

I'm glad it worked itself out. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Cheers,

-Claw
